header.name: chaos/preprocessor/recursion/phase.h
header.author: Paul Mensonides
header.overview: The header defines a macro used to relatively alter the of an expression.

macro.abstract: The macro is used to relatively alter the of an expression.

usage.param: The offset. Valid values range from 0 to - n.
The base quantity. Valid values range from 0 to - offset.
The macro whose invocation is to be .

macro.para: This macro the invocation of macro through offset + base scans.

Typical usage involves passing either the first part of the above invocation (i.e. (offset)) to another macro that is written in terms of the rest of the invocation. For example,
#define A(p) \ p(0, B)() p(1, B)() p(2, B)() \ /**/ #define B() 1
A((0)) // #1 A((1)) // #2
The first invocation expands to three invocations of B. Of these, the first is actually invoked, the second is delayed through one scan, and the third is delayed through two scans. The second invocation has the effect of increasing the of each of these by 1. The first of the three resulting invocations is delayed through one scan, the second is delayed through two scans, and the third is delayed through three scans.
